intro: Baccharis thymifolia, commonly known as sweet baccharis, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
